title: Augusta: William Brand to Kate Armentrout, April 6, 1862
summary: William tells Kate about recent casualties in his company and the re-organization of the company under new officers. He also says that, while things look "gloomy" at the present time, the soldiers in his regiment are in good spirits and ready to fight the enemy. He is less impressed with the militia.
keywords: Death/Casualties, Enlistment, Family, Military Authority, Patriotism, American Civil War
